project.teaser: The Icarus consortium has identified critical technology steps that at present limit the wider deployment of three Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) production routes, namely: biocrude from hydrothermal liquefaction to SAF, isobutanol from lignocellulosic biomass to SAF and...
project.objective: The Icarus consortium has identified critical technology steps that at present limit the wider deployment of three Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) production routes, namely: biocrude from hydrothermal liquefaction to SAF, isobutanol from lignocellulosic biomass to SAF and synthetic Fischer-Tropsh from biomass gasification to SAF. These three value chains have been strategically selected by Icarus since they are close to market deployment and are needed to meet European and international SAF deployment targets. Icarus aims to improve them with innovative solutions while at the same time addressing the whole value chain. Novel biomass production concepts such as sequential cropping and mix cropping are also addressed aiming to ensure increased sustainable biomass availability for SAF production. Along the complete value chain techno-economic, environmental, and social assessments will be carried out. Icarus has a very strong international consortium of 20 reputed partners including 5 from 3 Mission Innovation Countries (MIC) Canada, India and Brazil, who will carry out innovative research with common targets and objectives with the European ones ensuring international collaboration in this critical area. Two more partners from a 4th MIC, USA are joining research activities as members of the External Executive Advisory Board (EEAB). The Icarus results will significantly improve the cost effectiveness of SAF and therefore have global significance and reach and will facilitate scaling-up of these technologies and value chains enabling market deployment of SAF on a global scale. Guidelines, assessments, best practices and improved concepts will be used throughout the project to disseminate the results on global scale via targeted and effective dissemination and communication outreach activities to all stakeholders.
project.title: International cooperation for sustainable aviation biofuels
project.keywords: biomass diversification, biocrude oils, syngas, isobutanol, LCA, techno-economic-social assessment

article.title: Global partnership advances sustainable aviation fuels throughout the value chain

result.title: Market development Review of data addressing issues related to market development of SAF
result.description: D3.5 reports on a review of data addressing issues related to market development of SAF. such as certification schemes, standardization aspects and deployment targets.D3.5 is linked to Task 3.4

result.title: DMP & Support Pack
result.description: D6.3 reports on the Data Management Plan (DMP) & Support Pack.It is linked to Task 6.4

result.title: Overview of the VC Isobutanol to SAF
result.description: D1.3 aims to carry out a comprehensive literature review on innovative approaches such as catalyst types and operating conditions to convert isobutanol to SAF.D1.1 is linked to Task 1.3.

result.title: Enhancing Biomass Feedstocks for Sustainable Aviation Biofuel Production through Biostimulant

details.authors: Elena Ferro, Walter Zegada Lizarazu, Andrea Parenti, Elia Pagliarini, Francesca Gaggìa, Andrea Monti
details.journalTitle: 7TH DOCTORAL COLLOQUIUM BIOENERGY AND BIOBASED PRODUCTS

result.title: Technical assessment of selected SAFs
result.description: D3.1 reports on the process designs, energy, and mass balances for the industrial phase of SAF value chains.D3.1 is linked to Task 3.1

result.title: Overview of the VC Biocrude oils to SAF
result.description: D1.2 aims to perform a comprehensive review on innovative & promising catalytic hydrotreatment approaches for biocrudes produced after HTL and MO, by exploring the operational conditions applied, reactor configurations, feedstock and catalyst types, and results achieved for conversion performance and upgraded biocrude characterisation. D1.2 is linked to Task 1.2

result.title: Effect of Plant Growth-promoting Rhizobacteria Application on Lignocellulosic Crops Yield for Advanced Biofuels

details.authors: Parenti; Zegada-Lizarazu; Ferro; Pagliarini; Gaggia; Monti

result.title: Overview of biogenic feedstocks
result.description: D1.1 aims to report the technological developments of biogenic feedstocks for SAF production. Focus will be set on the biomass resources included in RED II Annex IX and relevant updates, as well as on sustainable feedstock supply over time.D1.1 is linked to Task 1.1

result.title: Ethics requirements
result.description: D6.4 reports on the Ethics requirements.It is linked to Task 6.5

result.title: Systematic constraints on entire value chains
result.description: D1.6 aims to report the analysis of constraints (environmental impact, feedstock risks, energy efficiency, final product growth trends, etc). GAP analysis will be used to compare the actual status of the SAF value chain to the desired situation in the future, which contributes to enhance the development and diffuse SAF production technologies that are approached in this project.D1.6 is linked to Task 1.6.

result.title: Nitrogen removal in HTL trials
result.description: D2.2 aims to report the optimization of the N removal from the feedstock during pretreatment and HTL processing D2.2 is linked to Task 2.2

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - ICARUS (International cooperation for sustainable aviation biofuels)
result.teaser: The ultimate objective of this proposal is to develop best practices (based on improved innovative technologies) and concepts (founded on market access knowledge) along entire value chains for accelerating the scale-up of sustainable aviation biofuels production worldwide...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Social assessment of selected SAF options
result.description: D3.4 reports on the social perspectives of involved stakeholders throughout the whole supply chains on socio-political and the market dimensions.D3.4 is linked to Task 3.3

result.title: Policies update
result.description: D1.7 is the final update of D1.5 and is linked to Task 1.5

result.title: Economic analysis of selected SAF options
result.description: D3.2 reports on the cost analysis (CAPEX, OPEX, production costs, GHG mitigation costs) for possible concepts for the selected in WP2 value chains.D3.2 is linked to Tasks 3.1 and 3.2

result.title: ISPR for isobutanol from fermentation broths - Operational boundaries
result.description: D2.5 aims to report on the operational boundaries for a pervaporation setup providing in situ isobutanol removal from fermentation broths.D2.5 is linked to Task 2.3

result.title: Policies overview
result.description: D1.5 aims to report a detailed analysis and mapping exercise of the existing policies and and legislation in force for the deployment of SAF, to identify common actions and practices.D1.5 is linked to Task 1.5

result.title: LCA and SDG analysis of SAFs
result.description: D3.3 reports on the LCA of SAF technologies and implications for SDGs.D3.3 is linked to Tasks 3.1 and 3.2

result.title: Overview of the VC Syngas to SAF
result.description: D1.4 aims to perform a literature review on the state-of-the-art catalysts and reactor design combinations, SAF yields, quality and the corresponding TRL level and current bottlenecks for once-through conversion of syngas into SAF.D1.4 is linked to Task 1.4.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
